biography.value:
Barnaby comes from a small village where he was always the odd one out, preferring arcane texts to farm chores. He ran away to the city and found his calling not in a dusty library, but in the lively atmosphere of taverns. He discovered he had a knack for mixing potent brews and an even greater talent for bending magic to his will, often in ways that surprised even himself. He now drifts from town to town, working as a tavern 'entertainer' (and occasional bouncer), always looking for a good time and a new spell to try out.

Behavior: Barnaby is loud, boisterous, and prone to bursts of wild magic when he's had a few too many. He loves a good brawl and often uses his magic to enhance his fighting prowess or to cause general chaos. He's not malicious, but his magic can be unpredictable, especially when he's had a drink.

Appearance: Barnaby is a stout human man with a perpetually flushed face, a messy brown beard often flecked with remnants of food or drink, and a twinkle in his eye that suggests mischief. He wears slightly rumpled leather armor over common clothes and always has a tankard within reach.

Twist: Despite his rowdy demeanor, Barnaby is a surprisingly accomplished wizard, having studied at a prestigious arcane academy before dropping out to pursue a life of 'adventure' and ale. His wild magic surges are often a result of him trying to suppress his true magical potential in favor of a more 'down-to-earth' fighting style.

Habitat: Taverns, inns, and bustling city districts.

Treasure: None

description.value: A thick shaft of wood wrapped with a sturdy grip makes a highly functional weapon in addition to a stout walking stick.
The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Barnaby is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Fire Bolt

1st level (4 slots): Grease, Shield, Magic Missile
2nd level (3 slots): Misty Step, Suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): Fireball, Haste
4th level (1 slot): Dimension Door

Barnaby has advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength checks made to resist being grappled or knocked prone. When he hits a creature with an unarmed strike as part of his Attack action, he can deal an extra 1d4 bludgeoning damage. If he is drunk (DM's discretion, usually after consuming alcohol), he gains advantage on his first attack roll each turn.

An improvised thrown weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus Barnaby's Strength modifier, and it has the light and thrown (range 20/60) properties. If Barnaby hits with it, he can also attempt to shove his target as a bonus action.
Often used for dramatic gestures or as an improvised bludgeoning weapon.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using INT as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Fire Bolt

3/Day Each: Grease, Shield, Magic Missile

2/Day Each: Misty Step, Suggestion, Fireball

1/Day Each: Haste, Dimension Door
